page.title: 08Children's Hobbies - Judo
page.content: by Darren Courtney I joined a judo club about 3 years ago Judo is a sport, where you practise throwing and falling on mats with a partner.In a real competition there are two people, one wears a red belt, the other a white one.There is a red line around the mats. The point of the game is for either one to throw the other over the red line only using throws and trips. Every 6 months there is a grading of everybody,when you receive a belt.The first belt is white,then white with a red tag, then on through until white with 3 red tags.These are called mon.When you have 3rd mon you go on to yellow,orange,green, blue, brown, black then white with 3 red blocks and finally red. Only one man has a red belt - he is a 90 year old Japanese man.
